message_1: How many ways are there to choose 3 out of 8 different fruits (apple, banana, cherry, durian, elderberry, fig, grape, and honeydew) to make a fruit salad?
message_2:
To choose 3 out of 8 different fruits, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of items, k is the number of items to choose, and ! denotes the factorial.

In this case, n = 8 (total number of fruits) and k = 3 (number of fruits to choose).

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!(8-3)!)

C(8, 3) = 8! / (3!5!)

C(8, 3) = (8 × 7 × 6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(8, 3) = (8 × 7 × 6) / (3 × 2 × 1)

C(8, 3) = 336 / 6

C(8, 3) = 56

So, there are 56 ways to choose 3 out of 8 different fruits to make a fruit salad.
